lines.text: How do we know we can trust the Indians to keep their word?
You got a point there. Indians got a point too. They've had dealings with whites before.
A man's dying doesn't mean very much to you, does it?
On the contrary, a man's dying means a lot to me.
Whatever I do I never apologize for it, do you?
Well, I do now... with reservations.
O, no excuses for discoverin' you're a real woman... my kind... never met one before.
Next I'll remind you of your mother.
You couldn't. I was raised in a foundling home.

[Asking about his gold panning]
What are you gettin', Sammy?

[to Laura referring to his feet in the crowded wagon]
I gotta put'em someplace, lady.
Pioneering in this country can be awful rough.
Men go where there's money to be made.
They go with the men who make it... or try.

[Alluding to Tinnen's duplicity]
Union coat, Confeerate trousers... it figures.
